channel.title: train on The TechGlider
channel.description: Recent content in train on The TechGlider

item.title: Status Update: Feb 26, 2010
item.description: BUSY: Setting up LAN at A Hostel (yay!) BUSY: Exams start on Wednesday March 3; worrying when to start study ;) BUSY: Trying to design a database to be used in CSED’s website BUSY: Thinking when to read the book The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams which has been chosen by me for a review BUSY: Thinking what date to reserve train tickets to home after end sems

item.title: Programming on your S60 phone!
item.description: How many of you know that you can actually use your S60 phone (that includes all N-Series Nokia phones and certain others) to do programming? :?: I just tried to this yesterday on my N72 and want to tell you that it’s a great fun to do and a finer way to cut time we waste in commuting (than listening to music or playing games on our mobile). Of course you need to know programming in order to utilize your phone in this manner.

item.title: That hard and tiring day of July 31
item.description: I mentioned about this day in my post of August 1. I started the day at night by wishing aÂ friend birthday, eventually making her wakeup at midnight. Then, came the inauguration of my website with my first post on The TechGlider Blog at 6 in the morning. This was the easy part of the day. I reached the Ghaziabad Railway Station at 7:50 to board the train to Tilak Bridge at Delhi, for I use to go to South Delhi to attend FIITJEE classes for IIT-JEE preparation.
